results.title: Neuroprotective Effects of Simvastatin and Cilostazol in L-Methionine-Induced Vascular Dementia in Rats.
results.text_hl: Neuroprotective Effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Cilostazol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077407 @@@Cilostazol@@@ in @CHEMICAL_Methionine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008715 @@@L-Methionine@@@-Induced @<m>DISEASE_Dementia_Vascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015140 @@@Vascular Dementia@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@Rats@@@.

results.title: Simvastatin restored vascular reactivity, endothelial function and reduced string vessel pathology in a mouse model of cerebrovascular disease.
results.text_hl: We conclude that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ could be indicated in the treatment of @DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@cerebrovascular dysfunction@@@ associated with @<m>DISEASE_Dementia_Vascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015140 @@@VaD@@@ and @DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@.

citations.NLM: Tong XK, Hamel E. Simvastatin restored vascular reactivity, endothelial function and reduced string vessel pathology in a mouse model of cerebrovascular disease. J Cereb Blood Flow Metab. 2015 Mar;35(3):512-20. PMID: 25564230

results.title: 24S-hydroxycholesterol: a marker of brain cholesterol metabolism.
results.text_hl: Recent epidemiological studies indicate that the prevalence of diagnosed @DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Dementia_Vascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015140 @@@vascular dementia@@@ is reduced among people taking statins for a longer period of time.

citations.NLM: Lütjohann D, von Bergmann K. 24S-hydroxycholesterol: a marker of brain cholesterol metabolism. Pharmacopsychiatry. 2003 Sep;36 Suppl 2():S102-6. PMID: 14574622
